page.title: 08Fire and Ambulance Station
page.content: The Fire Station is on the corner of Albert Rd. and Court Rd. At Southport there are 3 full time engines and a turntable ladder that is 27 years old. In an appliance, that weighs 7840 kg unladen and costs Â£60 000, 14 men can be carried. To become a fireman you must be over 18. The station handles 1700 calls per year. The Ambulance Station is behind the fire station. All calls are handled by the Control at Whiston, on the Wirral. We sat in an ambulance and put a plastic splint on our arm that had to be blown up.A loud bell rings in the station when there is an emergency.If there was a fire at one of Southport's big hotels fire engines and ambulances would have to be brought in from outside the area. In an emergency they can get to Ainsdale in less than seven minutes.
